page.title: 02CHILDREN'S HOBBIES
page.content: Children in our area have a wide variety of hobbies. In our sample of 5 to ll year olds there were just under 5O different hobbies. These range from active hobbies such as jogging, walking, horse riding, gymnastics, cycling, ice skating, roller skating and karate to more passive hobbies such as reading, watching television, collecting things,model making and playing with games and toys. The most unusual hobby in our survey was Death Sliding practised by a group of four boys in a garden. The most popular hobby involved 86% of the children in collecting a variety of interesting objects such as rubbers, key rings, stamps, stickers,posters, postcard teddies. hair clips, badges and medals. Other popular hobbies are swimming and roller skating.
